alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:19PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern West Baton Rouge, west central Livingston and central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 400 PM CDT... At 319 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Denham Springs, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Walker, Westminster, Old Jefferson, Merrydale, Inniswold, Watson, Shenandoah, Brownfields, Greenwell Spring and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 154 and 165. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston; West Baton Rouge
